alert.note: Alert for Bergen; Morris; Passaic (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 09 at 10:01PM EDT until July 11 at 5:00AM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Mount Holly NJ has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in New Jersey... Ramapo River At Pompton Lakes affecting Bergen, Morris, and Passaic Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY MORNING TO EARLY TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Ramapo River At Pompton Lakes. * WHEN...From Monday morning to early Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Nuisance, low lying flooding, occurs near the dam in the Pompton Lakes. At 11.5 feet, South section of Pompton Lakes experiences flooding. At 12.5 feet, Several residences in Pompton Lakes, along Riveredge Drive, take on water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:15 PM EDT Sunday the stage was 8.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tomorrow morning to a crest of 11.9 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 11.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 11.1 feet on 03/31/2010. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (8 pm) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Mon Tue Stg Time Date Ramapo River Pompton Lakes 11.5 8.9 Sun 9 pm 11.8 10.1 11.9 2pm 7/10 &&
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued Monday morning by 1030 AM EDT.
